TrainTransitReservation Application
===================================

DEMO VIDEO
----------
View this Google Slides Presentation: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1Yt_8nqV0NUmhH9rzMEyxNgDOBHgWWQNziuY3YHaK7To/edit?usp=sharing

Overview
--------
This web application allows three roles—manager (admin), customer representative (rep), and customer—to log in and perform their respective tasks:
  • Manager: manage reps, view revenue reports, search reservations, etc.  
  • Rep: view/edit schedules, answer customer questions, search messages.  
  • Customer: register, search schedules, book/cancel reservations, ask questions.

Default Credentials
-------------------
Managers (admin):
  • Username: mmanager  
    Password: mgrpass  

Customer Representatives (rep):
  • Username: royrep  
    Password: reppass  
  • Username: ritarep  
    Password: reppass2  

Customers:
  • Username: alice  
    Password: pass123  
  • Username: bob  
    Password: secret  
  • Username: carol  
    Password: mypwd  

(You can register additional customers via register.jsp.)

Database Setup
--------------
1. Create the database and schema:
     mysql -u root -p < TrainTransitReservation.sql

2. Seed sample data:
     mysql -u root -p TrainTransitReservation < SeedData.sql

3. Make sure user `tt_user` exists and has privileges:
     mysql> CREATE USER 'tt_user'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'tt_pass';
     mysql> GRANT SELECT,INSERT,UPDATE,DELETE 
            ON TrainTransitReservation.* 
            TO 'tt_user'@'%';
     mysql> FLUSH PRIVILEGES;

4. Confirm by logging into MySQL:
     mysql -u tt_user -p TrainTransitReservation
     mysql> SHOW TABLES;

Environment & Dependencies
--------------------------
• Java JDK 11+  
• Apache Tomcat 9  
• MySQL 8 (or compatible)  
• JDBC driver: place mysql-connector-j-9.3.0.jar in WEB-INF/lib  

Directory Layout
----------------
TrainTransitReservationApp/
├─ TrainTransitReservation.sql      ← schema + roles + grants  
├─ SeedData.sql
